B777

Configuration

Seat

  • B777 JC Seat

CSCP/CACP

Location

  • CSCP at L1 station
  • CACP at R2 station
  • CACP at L5 station
  • CSCP at L1 station
  • CSAPs at R2 and L4 (B777-200)/L5 (B777-300) stations


  • Operations
  • Troubleshooting
Operation

The CMS is on when the aircraft is powered. Crew cannot turn the CMS on or off.

  • CMS on the CSCP can access all cabin areas.
  • CMS on R2 CACP can access First Class and Business Class cabins.
  • CMS on L4 or L5 CACP can access Economy Class.
  • CACPs have an OVERRIDE button. When this button is selected there is access to all cabin areas.

Troubleshooting

If any of the CMS functions, CSCP or CACP fail:

  • Inform the Flight Crew.
  • If the issue is not fixed send an LICCC message to ground.
  • Follow any instructions received.
  • If the issue still not fixed, log it in the Cabin/IFE Defect Log Book and write a KIS report.

Window Shades

  • Customer Controls
  • B777-300 (New Model)
  • B777-200 and B777-300 (Old Model)
Customer Controls

  • The window frame has an up and down button to adjust the window shades.
  • First Class suite and Business class seat Mode Controller docking stations have a set of up and down buttons to control the Window shades.
  • First Class window shades are collectively controlled from R1 Crew Switch Panel (CSP).
  • Business Class window shades are collectively controlled from R2.

The available controls are:

  • SHADES LOCKED - disables customer control of the window shades.
  • SHADES OPEN - opens the window shades.
  • SHADES CLOSED - closes the window shades.
  • SHEER MODE - closes the first (thin) layer of the window shades.

B777-300 (New Model)

  • A manual tool is available in the base compartment of R2 jump seat.
  • The tool can only be used to open a window shade.
  • On 3 class aircraft - in the upper compartment behind L2
  • On 2 class aircraft - in the upper wall compartment of the dry galley by LR2
  • If an electric window shade fails:
  • Fit the tool into the hole above the window shade control buttons.
  • To open the window shade, turn the tool anticlockwise.
  • Move the customer to a different seat, if possible.
  • If the window shade is open, use a cardboard cover to cover the window shade.

B777-200 and B777-300 (Old Model)

  • Manual tools are available in the upper compartment behind L2 station, inside a yellow bag labelled ‘Window Shade Tool Kit’. The manual tools consist of 3 duplicate screw drivers.
  • If an electric window shade fails:
  • There is 1 hole above and 1 hole below the window shade control buttons.
  • Fit a tool into the hole below the window shade control buttons. Turn the tool to control the thin shade.
  • Fit a tool into the hole above the window shade control buttons. Turn the tool to control the thick shade.
  • Use the “L” shaped tool if space is not available to fit the longer tool.
